item.title:
Sciarids are fungus gnats, small harmless creatures that develop as larvae in damp, decaying organic matter
They migrate in unison, gliding on a thin layer of mucous they secrete to deter predators and conserve moisture

item.title: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Mmmm how good is SGD to initialize in your opinion? I feel like evolution provides the initialization framework that is necessary to find the solution islands. Once your are hooked onto a potential solution, it could be slower, yes.
item.description: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Mmmm how good is SGD to initialize in your opinion? I feel like evolution provides the initialization framework that is necessary to find the solution islands. Once your are hooked onto a potential solution, it could be slower, yes.
item.content:encoded: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Mmmm how good is SGD to initialize in your opinion? I feel like evolution provides the initialization framework that is necessary to find the solution islands. Once your are hooked onto a potential solution, it could be slower, yes.

item.title: @LecoqJerome @hardmaru I think it would still be better. Initialization in large, flat minima would be good, and SGD would get you there faster. I don't see any reason why evolution would produce better initializations...
item.description: @LecoqJerome @hardmaru I think it would still be better. Initialization in large, flat minima would be good, and SGD would get you there faster. I don't see any reason why evolution would produce better initializations...
item.content:encoded: @LecoqJerome @hardmaru I think it would still be better. Initialization in large, flat minima would be good, and SGD would get you there faster. I don't see any reason why evolution would produce better initializations...

item.title: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Yes, lots of these could be implemented. I still find it remarkable that so many things emerged from these simple evolutionary rules. The biological machinery and interdependence is so amazing. It might not be the fastest but it is robust and powerful.
item.description: @tyrell_turing @hardmaru Yes, lots of these could be implemented. I still find it remarkable that so many things emerged from these simple evolutionary rules. The biological machinery and interdependence is so amazing. It might not be the fastest but it is robust and powerful.

item.title:
Did you know? Airport runway numbers are not sequential: they are based on the magnetic heading on a compass for their orientation. Runway 9, for example means it oriented at 90 degrees; runway 27 is 270 degrees and so on
